reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Slightly away from the centre but it's only a 10 minute walk, or the number 4 tram stops right outside.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite it's origins as a jail, the hotel is very comfortable, pleasant and has the feel of a top end hotel. Food in the restaurant is nice but a tad on the expensive side. Free WiFi is available but due to the thick walls doesn't make it into the rooms.
reviews.title: Great place for small money

reviews.text: Good breakfast, nice, clean rooms, extremely quiet, had very good sleep. However parking is 16EUR...
reviews.title: 100% recommended.

reviews.text: Best choice in "price/quality" category. Very quiet residential location - 10 minutes walk or 3 minutes by tram to city center. 2-3 minutes walk to nearest bars & restaurants, pharmacy & supermarket. Fresh & stylish renovation. Comfortable room (if you prefer spacious rooms book Premier or Suite) with all needed facilities. Perfect service & polite personnel. Very good breakfast buffet included.
reviews.title: For good night sleep

reviews.text: This hotel is within 5 min walk to the daily quayside market. 10min to the Lindaline fast ferry to Tallin. The Hotel itself is an experience.. The old County Jail... We had a room which was converted from 3 cells, very tatstefully,asthetically done and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. The Staff.. excellent in all aspects and as with all Finns.. always hospitable.. I have no doubt I will return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel within 5 min of city centre

reviews.text: Helsinki itself is a very clean city with plenty tram connections which are easy to follow. It's a city with no visible signs of any criminal activitiy. Fazer's is the most excellent place to indulge in a multi calorie intake. .
reviews.title: hurry up!too good to last long

reviews.text: In the 5 days we were there we never saw any problem with the Law or any law enforcement being made. The infrastructure regaring the roads and motorways outwith the city are excellent. The best roads I have ever have driven on. The UK could learn a lot from the Soumi people... Only thing agains the hotel was the excessive parking fees.... for a hire car... however if you don't hire a car then it's not a problem Hire cars within the city -- Helsinki itself is fairly easy to navigate if you use a satnav. otherwise the buildings which are all at least 4 storeys high will prove a difficulty if you are there just for the weekend... especially in the dark...
reviews.title: Cool Hotel in Helsinki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A must is Tallin in Estonia, 1.5 hours fast ferry.. The old town square is like a mini version of old town square Prague..
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Another must is the Suemolinna Fortress - from Market square... every 30-40 minutes and make sure you have good walking shoes if you wish to go around the complete site. The submarine on the south side of the island is worth a visit if the times allow... Also make sure you are there when you watch the Viking line ferry negotiate the narrow channel inbound and outbound ..... scary for the captain of the vessel and you watching...
reviews.title: Great hotel, no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely done renovation of an old prison. Room was large and comfortable, and extremely quiet. Excellent amenities, including the excellent Jailbird restaurant. A bit away from the "action," (if Helsinki has action), but a day pass on the tram system puts you within easy, inexpensive reach of all Helsinki has to offer. An excellent stay in a fine small city, we recommend both the hotel and the city.
reviews.title: Prison Doesn't Seem so Bad

reviews.text: This is a great hotel, a little bit out of the city centre but in a pleasant 5-10 minutes walk to it, located in a quiet and elegant neighbourhood in an island east of Helsinki.
reviews.title: Most confortable prison ever!

reviews.text: As you could imagine, its main attractive is that the building was, until the 90s, Helsinki prison, and it really looks like it from outside and the interior corridors. Appart from that, it is a comfortable place to stay, with cozy and modern rooms that have all the ammenities, including a big flat screen-TV, a mini bar, nice firm beds and a complete en-suite bathroom (even for the basic ones).
reviews.title: Interesting hotel, great location

reviews.text: Our room was close to the main entrance, on the first floor, but it was still quiet and silent. It had a big window facing the rear garden, that was completely covered by the snow at that time.
reviews.title: you'll sleep in prison! But Sauna is only open 45min every day!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our rate, and was served in the former prison canteen, located in the -1 floor, with vaulted ceilings and great atmosphere. Food was abundant and of good quality.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

reviews.text: The building itself made the stay quite interesting and the room is immaculately renovated. Unfortunately, since I worked from my room, I realized that the walls of a prison can be a bit cold - I couldn't seem to turn up the heat enough in my room. The gentleman at reception overnight was extremely helpful and kind as I was checking out at 4am. He insisted that I didn't leave without having some breakfast and proceeded to run downstairs to make me a sandwich himself.
reviews.title: Really cool building and very helpful staff

reviews.text: The included breakfast downstairs at the Jailbird restaurant was fantastic. As I had limited time and it was very cold outside (10-15 minute walk to downtown), I also had two dinners at Jailbird which were equally terrible. The reindeer meal was cold and I nearly gagged on the soggy pizza.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Don't worry about bringing your own handcuffs, as the vending machine in the hallway sells them for 25€ along with an assortment of chocolate bars.
reviews.title: Exagerated town and hotels, too expensive

reviews.text: The way they have converted this former prison is stuning.
reviews.title: Too quiet for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Quite an experience being "inside"
